p: A total of 1.0 g of air-dried, powdered, and homogenized R. rosea roots and rhizomes were extracted with 100 mL of methanol using Extraction System B-811 (Büchi Labortechnik AG, Flawil, Switzerland). Soxhlet hot extraction with 25 extraction cycles, flushing, and drying was used. After evaporation of the solvent, the residue was dissolved in 10 mL of methanol. Then, 1.0 g of dry ethanolic and aqueous extracts was dissolved in 10 mL of methanol. All obtained extracts were filtered with a Supelco (Sigma-Aldrich ®, St. Louis, MO, USA) Iso-Disc™ Syringe Tip Filter Unit and a PTFE membrane with a 25 mm diameter and 0.22 μm pore size.
